title: Biochemistry of Health and Disease
requirements: Not for students who have taken LSCI1002.
description: This course provides a general introduction to the biochemistry of health and disease. Topics covered include nutrition and health, biomolecules and energy metabolism, molecular genetics and its applications in modern medicine, the immune system in health and disease, and the biochemistry of cancer. It is suitable for students (other than those who major in Life Sciences) who want to learn about the biochemical basis of various cellular functions and their relevance to disease. This course provides the fundamental knowledge that is essential to the study of other biochemistry or life science courses.

title: Basic Concepts in Biological Sciences
requirements: Not for students who have taken LSCI1002 or 1003.
description: This foundation course is designed for students who have not taken science courses with a biology component at the senior secondary school level. It presents our current understandings on cells and molecules of life, genetics and evolution, organisms and environment, and health and diseases. Those students who have successfully completed this course will have a solid foundation for studying more advanced courses in life sciences.

instructors: Dr. CHIU Chi Ming Lawrence
Dr. CHIU Chi Ming Lawrence

title: Introduction to Biological Sciences
description: This course aims to bring the students a holistic understanding of how life works. Basic concepts of biochemistry, cell biology, genetics and physiology are taught in the context of how life evolving from unicellular to multicellular organisms.
outcome: Students will be able to describe, integrate, and apply basic concepts of biological sciences, including fundamentals of biochemistry, cell biology, genetics and physiology.  Students will possess the fundamental knowledge that facilitates their learning in higher level courses of major programmes in life sciences.  Students will develop generic skills necessary in life sciences, including acquisition of appropriate study techniques, ability to ask critical questions, and application of problem-solving skills.  Students, through what they have learnt, will be able to develop popular science educational materials for their peers and high-school students.  學生將能夠描述、整合、並應用生物科學的基本概念，包括基本生物化學、細胞生物學、遺傳學、和生理學。  學生將具備生命科學的基本知識，有利於他們學習更進階的有關的課程。  學生將發展在生命科學領域所必需的能力，包括適當的學習技巧、判性思維和解決問題的能力。  學生將能通過學到的知識，為同輩及高中學生開發科普教材。
syllabus: Course Topics:  Membrane and Compartmentation Energy, Life and Metabolism The Central Dogma How life evolves from prokaryotes to eukaryotes, from unicellular to multicellular organisms Cell Division Differentiation and Development Cell Communications Reproduction課程主題: 細胞膜與隔室 能量、生命與新陳代謝 分子生物學的中心法則 生命如何從原核生物進化到真核生物、從單細胞生物到多細胞生物 細胞分裂 分化與發育 細胞通訊 生殖
required_readings: Reece JB et al. 2011. Campbell Biology Plus Mastering Biology Student Access Kit: Global Edition (11th Edition). Pearson Higher Education

title: Life Sciences for Engineers
requirements: Not for students who have taken LSCI1001.
description: This course gives engineering students exposure to some of the basic and essential concepts in biology and biotechnology. Topics include cell structure and energy metabolism, DNA structure and replication, protein structure and function, genetic engineering, stem cell and tissue regeneration, neural biology, cardiovascular system, muscle and skeletal system of animals, microbes and microbial biotechnology. The overall aim of this course is to introduce students with the fundamental ideas and concepts in life sciences especially those with relevance to engineering studies.
outcome: 1. Students will be able to understand and integrate some basic concepts of biology and biotechnology, especially those relevant to engineering studies 2. Students will develop generic skills necessary in life sciences, including acquisition of appropriate study techniques, ability to ask critical questions, and application of problem-solving skills  1. 學生將能夠理解和整合一些與工程研究相關的生物學和生物技術基本概念。 2. 學生將培養出在生命科學領域中所必需的共通能力，包括適當的學習技巧，提出關鍵問題 和解決問題的能力。  1. 学生将能够理解和整合一些与工程研究相关的生物学和生物技术基本概念。 2. 学生将培养出在生命科学领域中所必需的共通能力，包括适当的学习技巧，提出关键问题 和解决问题的能力。
syllabus: Topics 1. Introduction  2. Cells and molecules of life  a. Water  b. Biomolecules - DNA, RNA, proteins, lipids, carbohydrates  c. Subcellular structures and their functions  d. Bioenergetics and metabolism  3. From gene to protein  a. DNA as the molecule of heredity  b. DNA structure  c. Replication  d. Transcription  e. Translation  4. Genetic engineering  a. Recombinant DNA technology   b. PCR  c. Applications  5. Protein basics and engineering  a. Amino acids as building blocks  b. Protein structures and functions  c. Protein engineering – rational design vs. directed evolution  6. Stem cell and tissue regeneration  a. Basics of stem cell  b. Tissue regeneration  c. Therapeutic potential  7. Microbes and microbial biotechnology  a. Introduction to microbes  b. Microbes and the environment  c. Microbial biotechnology and its applications  8. Neural biology  a. Nerve, neuron and action potential  b. Neurotransmitters and synaptic transmission  9. Cardiovascular physiology  a. Heart as a pump, cardiac muscle, pacemaker potential  b. Blood pressure, flow, resistance and hemodynamics  c. Microcirculation and material exchange  10. Mechanics of body movement  a. Muscle fibers and muscle contraction  b. Neural and chemical regulation of muscle contraction  c. Muscles, bones, joints and movement  11. Homeostatic regulation of fluid and electrolyte balance  a. Nephron and kidney function  b. Glomerular filtration and renal clearance  c. Loop of Henle as a counter-current multiplier  d. Endocrine regulation of water and electrolyte balance  12. Negative feedback and the maintenance of body homeostasis  a. Regulation of body temperature  b. Regulation of blood glucose  c. Hypothalamo-pituitary-adrenal cortex axis  1) 課程簡介  2) 細胞和生命的分子 a. 水 b. 生物分子 - DNA，RNA，蛋白質，脂質和碳水化合物 c. 亞細胞結構及其功能 d. 生物能量和代謝  3) 從基因到蛋白質 a. DNA作為遺傳分子  b. DNA結構 c. 複製 d. 轉錄 e. 翻譯  4) 基因工程 a. DNA重組技術 b. 聚合酶鍊式反應（PCR） c. 應用  5) 蛋白質的基礎知識與蛋白質工程 a. 氨基酸 - 蛋白質的基本構成單位 b. 蛋白質結構與其功能 c. 蛋白質工程 – 理性設計與定向進化  6) 幹細胞與組織再生 a. 幹細胞的基礎知識 b. 組織再生 c. 在醫療上的發展潛力  7) 微生物與微生物技術 a. 微生物導論 b. 微生物與環境 c. 微生物技術及其應用  8) 神經生物學 a. 神經，神經元與動作電位 b. 神經傳遞素與突觸傳遞  9) 心血管生理學 a. 心臟 - 動力泵，心肌，起搏電位 b. 血壓，流量， 阻抗以及血液動力學 c. 微循環及物質交換  10) 身體運動力學 a. 肌肉纖維以及肌肉收縮 b. 肌肉收縮的神經及化學調控 c. 肌肉，骨骼，關節及運動  11) 體液和電解質的穩態調節 a. 腎元與腎功能 b. 腎小球過濾和腎臟清除律 c. 亨利氏環作為逆流倍增器 d. 水和電解質的內分泌調控  12) 負反饋調節和體內平衡  a. 體溫調控 b. 血糖調控 c. 下丘腦－垂體－腎上腺皮質軸  1) 课程简介  2) 细胞和生命的分子 a) 水 b) 生物分子 - DNA，RNA，蛋白质，脂质和碳水化合物 c) 亚细胞结构及其功能 d) 生物能量和代谢  3) 从基因到蛋白质 a) DNA作为遗传分子  b) DNA结构 c) 复制 d) 转录 e) 翻译  4) 基因工程 a) DNA重组技术 b) 聚合酶炼式反应（PCR） c) 应用  5) 蛋白质的基础知识与蛋白质工程 a) 氨基酸 - 蛋白质的基本构成单位 b) 蛋白质结构与其功能 c) 蛋白质工程 – 理性设计与定向进化  6) 干细胞与组织再生 a) 干细胞的基础知识 b) 组织再生 c) 在医疗上的发展潜力  7) 微生物与微生物技术 a) 微生物导论 b) 微生物与环境 c) 微生物技术及其应用  8) 神经生物学 a) 神经，神经元与动作电位 b) 神经传递素与突触传递  9) 心血管生理学 a) 心脏 - 动力泵，心肌，起搏电位 b) 血压，流量， 阻抗以及血液动力学 c) 微循环及物质交换  10) 身体运动力学 a) 肌肉纤维以及肌肉收缩 b) 肌肉收缩的神经及化学调控 c) 肌肉，骨骼，关节及运动  11) 体液和电解质的稳态调节 a) 肾元与肾功能 b) 肾小球过滤和肾脏清除律 c) 亨利氏环作为逆流倍增器 d) 水和电解质的内分泌调控  12) 负反馈调节和体内平衡  a) 体温调控 b) 血糖调控 c) 下丘脑－垂体－肾上腺皮质轴
recommended_readings: Johnson, A. T. (2011) Biology for engineers. Boca Raton, FL : CRC Press Silverthorn, D. U. (2009) Human physiology: an integrated approach. 5th edition. Benjamin Cummings,  Northrop, R. B., Connor, A. N. (2009) Introduction to molecular biology, genomics and proteomics for biomedical engineers. Boca Raton : CRC Press/Taylor & Francis Alberts, B., Bray, D., Hopkin, K., Johnson, A., Lewis, J., Raff, M., Roberts, K., Walter, P. (2009) Essential Cell Biology. Garland Science.

title: Introduction to Life Forms in the Biosphere
description: This course covers basic concepts in biodiversity and different life forms. Students will be introduced to organisms on terrestrial (soil, grassland, freshwater), in ocean (pelagic, coral reef, intertidal, deep-sea), as well as their history on earth. Concepts in evolution (microevolution, speciation, macroevolution), ecology (population ecology, community, and ecosystems), and genetics related to biodiversity and different life forms will also be introduced.
outcome: Knowledge: Organisms on terrestrial (soil, grassland, freshwater), in ocean (pelagic, coral reef, intertidal, deep-sea), as well as their history on earth. Concepts in evolution (microevolution, speciation, macroevolution), ecology (population ecology, community, and ecosystems), and genetics related to biodiversity and different life forms will also be introduced.Skill: Acquisition of appropriate study techniques, ability to ask critical questions, and application of problem-solving skills through examinationsValue: Appreciation of biodiversity and different life forms, sense of biological conservation and other environmental issues, awareness on the latest developments and advancements in biology.
syllabus: History of Life (An oxygen atmosphere, From prokaryotic to eukaryotic organism, From a single cell to multicellular organism, The Move to Land: stories from plants and vertebrates, Dinosaur world and the day after, History of Human) Pelagic Life - Phytoplankton, zooplankton Coral Reef Life - Corals and coral communities, Fish and other nekton Intertidal Life - Rocky shores and Kelp forests, Mudflats and Mangroves Deep-Sea Life - Deep sea communities Soil Life (Soil ecosystem and animals, soil and plant interaction, Soil and Climate change) Terrestrial Life (Succession and climax, vegetation covers, Animals and seed dispersal) Grassland Life (Types of grassland, Savanna and Great migration) Freshwater Life (Stream communities, Land-water interaction) Darwin and Evolution, Evolution of Populations Origin of Species, History of Life Population Ecology, Community Ecology, Ecosystems Genetics and Life
recommended_readings: Mader SS. 2010. Essentials of Biology (Second Edition). McGraw Hill, New York. Reece JB et al. 2011. Campbell Biology Plus Mastering Biology Student Access Kit: Global Edition (Ninth Edition). Pearson Higher Education.

Professor CHUI Pui Yi, 

Professor HUI Jerome Ho Lam

Professor HUI Jerome Ho Lam

title: Basic Laboratory Techniques in Life Sciences
description: This laboratory course will provide hand-on experience and practical demonstration to students in basic and essential techniques in Life Sciences, including bacterial cultures and aseptic techniques, use of microscopes, staining and sectioning techniques for microscopes, western blot analysis, preparing buffer solution, basic spectroscopic techniques, enzyme assay and polymerase chain reaction.
outcome: 1. To learn the basic techniques of Cell Biology and Biochemistry. 2. To understand the principles of various Cell Biology and Biochemistry techniques. 3. To know how to apply these techniques in future experiments to solve problems.  1. 掌握基本細胞生物學及生物化學實驗技巧 2. 認識不同細胞生物學及生物化學實驗方法原理 3. 理解在科學研究中實驗技巧的應用方法
syllabus: The course is divided into Biology sessions and Biochemistry sessions.  Biology Sessions: 1. Microscopic Studies of Plant and Animal Cells 2. Basic Microbial Techniques & Staining of Bacterial Cells for Microscopic Observation 3. Preparation of Microscopic Slide of Animal Cells: Dehydration, Clearing, Infiltration, Embedding, Sectioning and Staining 4. Western Blotting of Apoptosis Protein I 5. Western Blotting of Apoptosis Protein II  Biochemistry Sessions: 1. Basic Bioinformatics Skill 2. pH and Buffer 3. Spectroscopic determination of protein and DNA 4. Enzymatic and non-enzymatic Hydrolysis of Ester Substrate 5. PCR Detection of Water-Borne Microbial Pathogens  本課程分為生物學實驗部份及生物化學實驗部份。  生物學實驗課程︰ 1. 動植物細胞的顯微研究 2. 基本微生物實驗技巧及細菌細胞染色技術 3. 動物細胞玻片標本製作︰顯微切片技術 4. 細胞凋亡蛋白質印跡分析I 5. 細胞凋亡蛋白質印跡分析 II  生物化學實驗課程︰ 1. 基本生物資訊學技術 2. 酸鹼值與溶液 3. 蛋白質及DNA分光鏡分析 4. 酯類受質的酵素及非酵素水解 5. 水媒致病性微生物的聚合酶鏈反應偵測
recommended_readings: 1. Laboratory manual provided by the instructors 2. The World of The Cell (7th Edition-2009) by Becker, Kleinsmith, Hardin & Bertoni (Pearson) 3. Molecular Biology of THE CELL (5th Edition-2008) by Prescott, Harley & Klein (McGraw-Hill Education) 4. Germain, M., Scovassi, A.I. and Poirier, G.G. 2000. Role of poly(ADP-ribose) polymerase in apoptosis. In Cell Death the Role of Poly(ADP-ribose) Polymerase, ed. C. Szabó, 209-26. Boca Raton: CRC Press. 5. Affar, E.B., Gobeil, S., Germain, M., Winstall, E., Shah, R., Bourassa, S., St-Cyr, J., Boucher, C. and Poirier, G.G. 2000. Role of poly(ADP-ribose) polymerase in apoptosis. In Cell Death the Role of Poly(ADP-ribose) Polymerase, ed. C. Szabó, 305-22. Boca Raton: CRC Press.

title: Scientific Conduct and Ethics
description: For life sciences majors to appreciate public interest, and ethical concerns from the society, to develop their professional mind. Students will need to consider controversial issues relating to reproduction and life, cloning, stem cell research, animal testing, uses and testing of drug, scientific research practices, clinical trials, intellectual and property rights, etc. Related ordinances and regulations will also be introduced and examined in this course.
outcome: The course provides guidance to the students for developing a professional and creative mindset with considerations from the general public and the society. Students taken this course are anticipated to understand the problems associated the following controversial issues: meaning of life and reproduction technology, embryonic stem cell and cloning research, animal uses and testing, drug uses and testing, clinical trials and scientific research, intellectual and property rights, etc. The students are expected to learn and understand existing laws and regulations related to bioethics and scientific conducts.  本科為同學發展其專業及創意思維的同時，得兼顧公眾及社會的考慮。同學完成本科後得明白以下項目所引起的具爭議問題：生殖技術和生命的意義，胚胎幹細胞和克隆的硏究，動物的使用和測試，藥物的使用和測試，臨牀試驗及科學硏究，和尊重知識產權。同學應學習及明白現有生物道德和科學倫理的相關法律和規章。  本科为同学发展其专业及创意思维的同时，得兼顾公众及社会的考虑。同学完成本科后得明白以下项目所引起的具争议问题：生殖技术和生命的意义，胚胎干细胞和克隆的硏究，动物的使用和测试，药物的使用和测试，临牀试验及科学硏究，和尊重知识产权。同学应学习及明白现有生物道德和科学伦理的相关法律和规章。
syllabus: The following topics with their associated ethical concerns and laws, will be introduced. [1] Reproduction technology  [2] Euthanasia and the meaning of life [3] Cloning and manipulation of embryonic stem cells [4] Animal testing and handling [5] Clinical trial conducts [6] Drug abuse, testing, overdose of antibiotics and drug resistance [7] Scientific conducts: how to design relevant controls in your experiments to collect reliable data for hypothesis testing? [8] Intellectual properties: how to make claims of your invention and respect others’ claims?  以下項目,及其相關倫理考慮及法例，會被論及： [1] 生殖技術 [2] 安樂死及生命的意義 [3] 克隆及胚胎幹細胞的操控 [4] 動物的測試和使用 [5] 臨牀測試的倫理問題 [6] 藥物濫用，測試，過量使用抗生素和抗藥性 [7] 科學倫理 : 如何設計對照組實驗以收集可靠數據來驗証假說? [8] 知識產權 : 如何為你的發明申請專利及尊重別人的專利?  以下项目，及其相关伦理考虑及法例，会被论及： [1] 生殖技术 [2] 安乐死及生命的意义 [3] 克隆及胚胎干细胞的操控 [4] 动物的测试和使用 [5] 临牀测试的伦理问题 [6] 药物滥用，测试，过量使用抗生素和抗药性 [7] 科学伦理 : 如何设计对照组实验以收集可靠数据来验证假说? [8] 知识产权 : 如何为你的发明申请专利及尊重别人的专利?
required_readings: To be assigned by course instructors

title: Summer Junior Project
description: This STOT course is designed to provide Life Science majors to work with the community on local issues with a scientific mind and with concepts of global citizenship. Students are encouraged to develop their own project with innovative ideas, design their own projects and presentation style to engage the community for science education and technology promotion. Students are also encouraged to work with non-government organizations, schools and local communities on their projects with both qualitative and quantitative analyses.
outcome: After studying this course, students are expected to experience the following learning outcomes  associated with global citizenship and social enterprisingness: 1. Learn how to develop and design a project to engage the community and apply knowledge learned to solve societal problems or issues in locality around us 2. Learn how to engage people and build up your team to work together 3. Learn how to allocate tasks on a specific project and set deadline to finish on time the jobs proposed 4. Learn how to explain your ideas to engage the community and your peers with innovative media 5. Learn how to acquire and collect data or information, and how to analyze and compare your data or information to organize the results and discussions 6. Learn how to present your project with data and information to the general public professionally and timely
syllabus: Students will be formed in groups to discuss and confirm their projects by end of May. The project will last for 6 weeks, and be completed with a formal oral presentation (group presentation in video), and final written report (Individual Report). Students are also required to submit their project proposal, work sheet, job distribution, and lab log for marking. Potential projects should cover the study of biochemistry, biology, cell and molecular biology, environmental science, food and nutritional sciences, molecular biotechnology, etc. A project covering several fields or research areas are most welcome. There is no specific content for this course, which is guided by a supervisor and the project is to be endorsed by the supervisor.  1. From the above suggested topics, students need to brain storm their own project with adequate background research done with literature review (last two weeks of May); - Students should have read relevant published reports and interview experts in the field to design their project; - Students should come up with project title, subtitles, and goals of the project.  2. Present a one page project proposal for approval by end of May - Before they start, all projects must be approved by a staff supervisor; - Check if safety or ethic approvals are needed.  3. Start the project by June 1 - Proceed to carry on the project with clear guidelines and schedule; - Students are expected to work on the project in a multitasking mode.  4. Prepare to sum up the data and findings by June 30; and prepare how to do oral presentations in a 15 min video - have the interim report presented to marks for final comments; - Round up your project according to your supervisor’s suggestions.  5. July 1-7, written report writing and submission - Submit video and report on time to e-learning site; - Your final appeal to your community and partners of the reports and video submitted.
recommended_readings: [1] Chipchase J (2017) Field Study Handbook (https://www.thefieldstudyhandbook.com ) [2] Food and Nutritional Survey: https://www.nal.usda.gov/fnic/food-and-nutrition-surveys  [3] Hospital Authority, HKSAR Government, Public-Private Partnership: http://www3.ha.org.hk/ppp/homepage.aspx?lang=eng  [4] Seidman LA & Moore CJ (2000) Basic Laboratory Methods for Biotechnology, Textbook and Laboratory Reference, Prentice Hall, NJ, USA. [5] Tree survey: http://www.treesurvey.org/tree-survey/what-is-a-tree-survey/  [6] Wagner T and Sanford R (2005) Environmental Science: Active Learning Laboratories and Applied Problem Sets. John Wiley and Sons, Inc. GE76 W34 2005 ul [7] http://study.com/academy/lesson/civil-society-and-citizenship.html  [8] Detection of GM Foods: http://eprints.icrisat.ac.in/109/1/TrendsInBiot__20_5_215-223__2002.pdf

title: Synthetic Biology Workshop
description: This course engages students working as a group project on designing and making genetic engineering machines using synthetic biology concepts. Students taking this course should have been, but not limited to, a registrant of the international genetic engineering machines (iGEM) competition and worked as part of the team. Students are required to submit a detailed proposal with poster and wiki page with specific contributions that the student has made; individual (independent) project written report is also required for course evaluation.
outcome: The course provides training to the students for carrying out a synthetic biology project. Students taken this course are anticipated to develop the following abilities: 1) Participate a synthetic biology project with students from different disciplines 2) Design experimental procedures and set up in a synthetic biology project 3) Involve in designing and making biobricks or computing programme for a specially designed task  4) Able to make effective presentations (oral, poster, wiki, thesis report) 5) Develop the concepts of creativity, entrepreneurship and intellectual property   本科指導學生參與合成生物學的專題研究。學生將會發展以下能力： 1) 與其他不同背景範疇的同學一同參與專題研究 2) 為一合成生物學課題設計和訂定實驗內容 3) 作一特定設計項目參與設計和製作生物零件或電腦程式 4) 能利用不同形式(包括口頭、網頁、 海報、和論文)有效地提交工作報告 5) 對創新思維，企業發展和知識產權有基本認識  本科指导学生参与合成生物学的专题研究。学生将会发展以下能力： 1) 与其它不同背景范畴的同学一同参与专题研究 2) 为一合成生物学课题设计和订定实验内容 3) 作一特定设计项目参与设计和制作生物零件或计算机程序 4) 能利用不同形式(包括口头、网页、 海报、和论文)有效地提交工作报告 5) 对创新思维，企业发展和知识产权有基本认识
syllabus: Part A. Project design. To design a synthetic biology project to accomplish a special task. Part B. Experiments. To participate in experimental work, data mining or computer modeling/programming. Part C. Presentation. To make an oral presentation in front of the poster; prepare a wiki site of the project and highlight the parts of the student’s involvement; write a brief written report to explain what the students have contributed and achieved.   甲. 項目設計：為一特定目標設計一合成生物項目 乙. 實驗：參與投入實驗工作，數據分析，或電腦模型或程式製作 丙. 工作報告：作一海報並提交口頭報告；擬定好一維基網頁並指出學生參與的部份；提供一精簡的論文報告以解釋同學的重要貢獻和達成的部份。  甲. 项目设计：为一特定目标设计一合成生物项目 乙. 实验：参与投入实验工作，数据分析，或计算机模型或程序制作 丙. 工作报告：作一海报并提交口头报告；拟定好一维基网页并指出学生参与的部份；提供一精简的论文报告以解释同学的重要贡献和达成的部份。
required_readings: Gibson et al., 2010. Creation of a bacterial cell controlled by a chemically synthesized genome. Science 329, 52-56. De las Heras et al., 2010. Engineering input/output nodes in prokaryotic regulatory circuits. FEMS Microbiology Review 34, 842-865. Helman et al., 2007. Bio Building Basics: A Conceptual Instruction Manual for Synthetic Biology. UCSF. 24p. Weber W & Fussenegger M, 2010. Synthetic gene networks in mammalian cells. Current Opinion in Biotechnology 21, 1-7.

instructors:
Professor CHAN Ting Fung Philos, 

Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky
Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky

Professor CHAN Ting Fung Philos, 

Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky

title: Literature Research
description: Students, with the help of a supervisor, will identify a specific topic in life sciences to perform a literature research, and critically assess the scientific basis of the conclusions drawn. Students will discuss regularly with the supervisor and summarize the research findings in an oral presentation and a review paper.Advisory: This capstone course is for final year students major in Biochemistry, Biology, Environmental Science, Food and Nutritional Sciences, and Molecular Biotechnology. For other students who want to enroll to this course, they have to first seek consent from the course coordinator.
outcome: The students will be able to: 1. find relevant scientific literature in life sciences  2. interpret and analyze the experimental data presented in the scientific literature  3. understand the research methodology 4. summarize the findings in the scientific literature, and present them to the   peers 5. write a review article on a current research topic in life sciences     學生將會發展以下能力: 1. 搜尋與生命科學相關文獻的技巧 2. 具批判性思維閱讀及分析解釋有關文獻的實驗數據 3. 認知及思考其研究方法 4. 概述相關文獻的結果，並向導師及同學匯報 5. 撰寫現今生物科學的發展及關注問題之報告   学生将会发展以下能力: 1. 搜寻与生命科学相关文献的技巧 2. 具批判性思维阅读及分析解释有关文献的实验数据 3. 认知及思考其研究方法 4. 概述相关文献的结果，并向导师及同学汇报 5. 撰写现今生物科学的发展及关注问题之报告
syllabus: Students, with the help of a supervisor, will identify a specific research topic in life sciences to perform a literature research. The students will first search for the relevant scientific literatures using online databases such as PubMed (www.pubmed.org). The scientific literatures should cover both review articles as well as original research papers. The students should understand the methodology of research described so that they can critically assess the experimental basis of the conclusions drawn in these papers. After reading a number of relevant papers in the selected topics, the students will summarize the research findings and present them in an oral presentation and submit a review article.  同學將經由導師的指導及協助下，對與生命科學相關之研究課題進行文獻研究。同學需利用相關的數據庫如PubMed (www.pubmed.org）對有關的科學文獻,猶是其原創性研究論文, 及其涵蓋的評論文章與資科進行搜索及研究。同學亦需深入理解及應用相關的實驗依據及其方法. 並就其文獻調查提交報告及作口頭專題報告。  同学将经由导师的指导及协助下，对与生命科学相关之研究课题进行文献研究。同学需利用相关的数据库如PubMed (www.pubmed.org）对有关的科学文献,犹是其原创性研究论文, 及其涵盖的评论文章与资科进行搜索及研究。同学亦需深入理解及应用相关的实验依据及其方法. 并就其文献调查提交报告及作口头专题报告。
required_readings: Relevant reference materials to the selected project will be provided by the supervisor
recommended_readings: Relevant reference materials to the selected project will be provided by the supervisor

instructors: Dr. LO Fai Hang

title: Group Research in Life Sciences
requirements: Not for students who have taken BCHE4902, BIOL4902, CMBI4902, ENSC4902, FNSC4902, MBTE4902 or LSCI4000.
description: This course is a capstone course consists of group projects to investigate the heated topics related to Life Sciences, such that students will be inspired by how different fields of life sciences have made their impacts on the globalized knowledge-based society of Hong Kong.

title: Group Research in Life Sciences (I)
requirements: Not to be taken with BCHE4901, BIOL4901, CMBI4901, ENSC4901, FNSC4901 and MBTE4901 at the same term
description: This course is a capstone course consists of group research projects to investigate the heated topics related to Life Sciences, such that students will be inspired by how different fields of life sciences have made their impacts on the globalized knowledge-based society of Hong Kong. In this course, students form a group to carry out an independent laboratory-based/non-laboratory-based research project either provided by the supervisor or jointly decided with the group. To fulfill the course requirement, students are required to discuss their progress with their supervisors regularly and submit a research proposal. In the event that one or more member(s) of the same group will not be enrolled in LSCI4912, the remaining member(s) will continue to finish the research project with the consent ofthe supervisor.
outcome: 1. Recognize how different aspects of life sciences make various impacts on the society and environment of Hong Kong;2. Design a group research project to address the scientific questions or problems related to the society and environment of Hong Kong;3. Read scientific literature relevant to their research project;4. Acquire practical research skills of information search from various types of databases and/or hands-on research techniques in conducting experiments;5. Recognize, analyze, and comment on the scientific and ethical issues of certain basic research and applications of different fields of life sciences in Hong Kong;6. Develop practical skills in team building, problem-solving and communication through different types of learning activities;7. Develop a sense of responsibility and team spirit;8. Improve skills in writing scientific proposal;9. Gain learning methodologies that promote life-long learning in life sciences to promote its impact on the society.1. 認識生命科學的不同方面如何對香港的社會和環境產生各種影響；2. 設計小組研究計劃，以解決與香港社會和環境有關的科學問題；3. 閱讀與其研究項目有關的科學文獻；4. 從各種類型的數據庫中獲得信息搜索的實踐研究技能和/或進行實驗的研究技術；5. 認識，分析和評論香港生命科學各個領域的某些基礎研究和應用的科學和倫理問題；6. 通過不同類型的學習活動，培養團隊建設，解決問題和交流方面的實踐技能；7. 培養責任心和團隊合作精神；8. 提高科學寫作和口頭表達能力；9. 獲得終身學習生命科學知識的學習方法並促進其對社會的影響。
syllabus: The students should take the initiative to form groups with three to four students at the beginning of the term. Students from different programmes are highly recommended.  Students in one group should discuss with their supervisors and compromise a topic for the group research project. This project should not be just a purely academic research study but a project related to various impact of life sciences on the society of Hong Kong with or without some laboratory-based research components. The students in a group are required to investigate the proposed topic with teamwork and team building elements. The students should first survey the background of their research project and identify the scientific questions they want to address. The students then design and perform the laboratory-based experiments and/or non-laboratory-based research for this project under the guidance of the supervisors and submit a research proposal in the term end.Potential projects should include components as follows,1. Knowledge-oriented trainingStudents should attend laboratory training, workshop or tutorials, in which the core knowledge of relevant scientific knowledge of life sciences, including laboratory-based experimental design, scientific paper reading and writing, and basic calculation and statistics in life sciences, etc. are given.2. Technical skill-orientated trainingStudents should arrange their practical training, including laboratory-based research skills, information technology and data search, computer software for data analysis, etc. for their projects.3. Experience and exposure enhancementStudents should participate in various learning activities such as 1) laboratory-based research; 2) surveys; 3) site visits; 4) field studies, etc. and learn to appreciate the applications of Life Sciences for social enterprises.4. Teamwork and team buildingStudents should learn the importance of good collaboration among the people working in a group to achieve a shared goal. The team members should share the vision to complete the project effectively and efficiently before a deadline. Also, students working in a team should learn to trust and respect each other and every member should have its own duties and responsibilities.在學期開始時，學生應主動與三至四個學生組成小組。小組建議由來自不同課程的學生組成。同組學生應該與他們的 導師討論，並為小組研究項目確定一個主題。這個項目不應只是純粹的學術研究，而應與生命科學對香港社會的各種 影響有關，當中可以帶有或不帶有實驗室研究的成分。小組中的學生需要通過團隊合作和帶有團隊建設的元素來研究 提議的主題。學生應首先調查研究項目的背景並確定他們要解決的科學問題。然後，學生在導師的指導下設計和執行 此項目的實驗室實驗和/或非實驗室研究，並在學期末提交研究建議書。研究項目應包括以下內容：1. 以知識主導的培訓學生應參加實驗室培訓，講習班或個別指導，其中應提供與生命科學相關的科學知識的核心知識，包括基於實驗室的 的實驗設計，科學論文的閱讀和寫作以及生命科學的基本計算和統計等。2.以技術技能為導向的培訓學生應安排實踐培訓，包括基於實驗室的研究技能，信息技術和數據搜索，用於數據分析的計算機軟件等。3.增加經驗和接觸學生應參加各種學習活動，例如1）實驗室研究 ; 2）調查 ; 3）實地考察 ; 4）實地研究等，並學習欣賞生命科學在社 會企業中的應用。4.團隊合作和團隊建設學生應該學習在團隊中的人們之間進行良好協作以實現共同目標的重要性。團隊成員應該分享願景，以便在截止日期 之前有效地完成項目。同樣，團隊合作的學生應該學會互相信任和互相尊重，每個成員都應該有自己的職責和責任。
required_readings: Relevant reference materials will be provided by the supervisor.

instructors: Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky

title: Group Research in Life Sciences (II)
requirements: Not to be taken with BCHE4902, BIOL4902, CMBI4902, ENSC4902, FNSC4902, MBTE4902 and LSCI4000 at the same term.
description: This course is a capstone course consists of group research projects to investigate the heated topics related to Life Sciences, such that students will be inspired by how different fields of life sciences have made their impacts on the globalized knowledge-based society of Hong Kong. Students are required to discuss their progress with their supervisor(s) regularly and submit a progress report at the end of the term. For student who will not be enrolled in LSCI 4913, a final report in the form of a manuscript and an oral presentation are assessed at the end of term for performance. In the event that one or more member(s) of the same group will not be enrolled in LSCI4913, the remaining member(s) will continue to finish the research project with the consent of the supervisor.
outcome: Recognize how different aspects of life sciences make various impacts on the society and environment of Hong Kong; Execute a group research project to address the scientific questions or problems related to the society and environment of Hong Kong; Survey scientific literature relevant to their research project; Acquire practical research skills of information search from various types of databases and/or hands-on research techniques in conducting experiments; Recognize, analyze, and comment on the scientific and ethical issues of certain basic research and applications of different fields of life sciences in Hong Kong; Develop practical skills in team building, problem-solving and communication through different types of learning activities; Develop problem-solving skills; Develop a sense of responsibility and team spirit; Improve skills in scientific writing; Gain learning methodologies that promote life-long learning in life sciences to promote its impact on the society. 認識生命科學的不同方面如何對香港的社會和環境產生各種影響； 進行小組研究計劃，以解決與香港社會和環境有關的科學問題； 調查與其研究項目有關的科學文獻； 從各種類型的數據庫中獲得信息搜索的實踐研究技能和/或進行實驗的研究技術； 認識，分析和評論香港生命科學各個領域的某些基礎研究和應用的科學和倫理問題； 通過不同類型的學習活動，培養團隊建設，解決問題和交流方面的實踐技能； 發展解決問題的能力； 培養責任心和團隊合作精神； 提高科學寫作能力； 獲得終身學習生命科學知識的學習方法並促進其對社會的影響。
syllabus: The students should continue to work on the research project from LSCI4910. Students should discuss the progress with their supervisors and submit a progress report in the term end. If the students will not continue to work on the research project in LSCI4912, they should submit a final report in the form of manuscript and present orally in the term end.學生應繼續從事LSCI4910的研究項目。學生應與他們的導師討論進度，並在學期末提交進度報告。如果學生不再繼續從事LSCI4912中的研究項目，則應以論文形式提交最終報告，並在學期末作出口述報告。
required_readings: Relevant reference materials will be provided by the supervisor.

instructors: Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky
Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky

title: Group Research in Life Sciences (III)
requirements: Not to be taken with BCHE4903, BIOL4903, CMBI4903, ENSC4903, FNSC4903, MBTE4903 and LSCI4000 at the same term. Pre-requisite: LSCI4912.
description: This course is a capstone course consists of group research projects to investigate the heated topics related to Life Sciences, such that students will be inspired by how different fields of life sciences have made their impacts on the globalized knowledge-based society of Hong Kong. In this course, students continue to work on and finish up the research project from LSCI4912. Relevant data analysis and conclusion formulation are performed after discussion with supervisors. A final report in the form of a manuscript and an oral presentation are assessed at the end of term for performance.
outcome: Recognize how different aspects of life sciences make various impacts on the society and environment of Hong Kong; Execute a group research project to address the scientific questions or problems related to the society and environment of Hong Kong; Survey scientific literature relevant to their research project; Acquire practical research skills of information search from various types of databases and/or hands-on research techniques in conducting experiments; Recognize, analyze, and comment on the scientific and ethical issues of certain basic research and applications of different fields of life sciences in Hong Kong; Develop practical skills in team building, problem-solving and communication through different types of learning activities; Develop problem-solving skills; Develop a sense of responsibility and team spirit; Improve skills in scientific writing and oral presentation; Gain learning methodologies that promote life-long learning in life sciences to promote its impact on the society. 認識生命科學的不同方面如何對香港的社會和環境產生各種影響； 進行小組研究計劃，以解決與香港社會和環境有關的科學問題； 調查與其研究項目有關的科學文獻； 從各種類型的數據庫中獲得信息搜索的實踐研究技能和/或進行實驗的研究技術； 認識，分析和評論香港生命科學各個領域的某些基礎研究和應用的科學和倫理問題； 通過不同類型的學習活動，培養團隊建設，解決問題和交流方面的實踐技能； 發展解決問題的能力； 培養責任心和團隊合作精神； 提高科學寫作和口頭表達能力； 獲得終身學習生命科學知識的學習方法並促進其對社會的影響。
syllabus: In this course, students continue to work on and finish up the research project from LSCI 4911. Relevant data analysis and conclusion formulation are performed after discussion with supervisors. A final report in the form of a manuscript and an oral presentation are assessed at the end of term for performance. 在本課程中，學生將繼續從事並完成LSCI 4911的研究項目。在與導師討論後，進行相關數據分析和結論制定。在學期末以論文和口頭陳述形式提交最終報告。
required_readings: Relevant reference materials will be provided by the supervisor.

instructors: Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky
Professor NGO Chi Ki Jacky

title: Introduction to Graduate Research in Life Sciences I
requirements: For students in MPhil-PhD Biochemistry; or Biology; or Environmental Science; or Food & Nutritional Sciences; or Molecular Biotechnology; or Cell and Molecular Biology
description: This course discusses basic research methods, data analysis, writing and presentation skills, and principles of selected experimental techniques in life sciences. Topics to be covered may vary from year to year. Proposed topics include laboratory management, information search, experimental design, biostatistics, writing of research proposal, thesis and scientific papers, techniques in conference presentations, bioinformatics, flow cytometry, confocal microscopy, real-time PCR, recombinant protein technology, animal transgenesis and gene tree construction.

title: Introduction to Graduate Research in Life Sciences II
requirements: For students in MPhil-PhD Biochemistry; or Biology; or Environmental Science; or Food & Nutritional Sciences; or Molecular Biotechnology; or Cell and Molecular Biology
description: This course provides students with hands-on experience in research methods, data analysis, writing and presentation skills, and experimental techniques discussed in its counterpart course, LSCI 5000 Introduction to Graduate Research in Life Sciences I. Students of this course will enhance and consolidate their understanding of the principles learned in LSCI 5000 by participating in experiments and workshops.

title: Advanced Topics in Cell and Molecular Biology
requirements: For students in MPhil-PhD Biochemistry; or Biology; or Environmental Science; or Food & Nutritional Sciences; or Molecular Biotechnology; or Cell and Molecular Biology
description: This graudate course focuses on recent developments in cell and molecular biology, aiming at introducing the latest concepts and technologies in the field. The course is provided in both lecture and journal club formats. Following lectures given by the teachers, students will be required to work on selected papers by critical reading and evaluation. This will be followed by student presentation and class discussion.

title: Advanced Topics in Environmental Science
requirements: For students in MPhil-PhD Biochemistry; or Biology; or Environmental Science; or Food & Nutritional Sciences; or Molecular Biotechnology; or Cell and Molecular Biology
description: Review of current topics in environmental science. Critical reading and evaluation of current literature. Selected papers will be analysed and discussed in detail among the teacher(s) and students.

title: Advanced Topics in Bioinformatics and Omic Sciences
Advanced Topics in Immunology and Cancer Research
Advanced Topics in Marine and Environmental Science
Advanced Topics in Biological Electron Microscopy and Live Cell Imaging
Seminar
requirements: For students in MPhil-PhD Biochemistry; or MPhil-PhD Biology; or MPhil-PhD Environmental Science; or MPhil-PhD Food & Nutritional Sciences; or MPhil-PhD Molecular Biotechnology; or MPhil-PhD Cell and Molecular Biology
description: Students will survey the literature in their chosen field of research and present a critical seminar on the topic. Presentation topics can also be chosen from an area that is relevant to their research.
